title: Testing (CEA Operations Only)
description: Requirements for testing programs in Controlled Environment Agriculture (CEA) operations including environmental monitoring, seed/product testing, corrective action procedures, sampling personnel training, laboratory quality assurance, and laboratory separation

requirements.text: Is the operation a CEA operation? Information gathering. If the answer is YES, continue with the next question. If the answer is NO, the rest of Module 3 is not applicable. Information gathering question
mandatoryStatements: This is an information gathering question
Response determines if operation is Controlled Environment Agriculture (CEA)
If YES, questions 3.14.02 through 3.14.08 are applicable
If NO, remaining Module 3 questions are not applicable
requirements.verificationExpectations: Documentation of whether operation meets CEA definition

requirements.text: Is there a written risk-based, scientifically valid environmental monitoring program?
mandatoryStatements: Written environmental monitoring (EM) program is documented
Program is risk-based (targets high-risk areas and food contact surfaces)
Program is scientifically valid (appropriate methods and sampling)
Program identifies what to test (surfaces, zones, indicators/pathogens)
Program identifies where to test (food contact surfaces, non-food contact, environment)
Program specifies testing frequency based on risk
Program defines acceptance criteria
Program includes trending and analysis of results
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of EM program for scientific validity and risk-based approach
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly verification that EM program is implemented as written

requirements.text: Are there written risk-based corrective action procedures for when unacceptable environmental monitoring results are received that describe the steps to be taken, and assign responsibility for taking those steps?
mandatoryStatements: Written corrective action procedures exist for unacceptable EM results
Procedures are risk-based (escalate response based on finding location/organism)
Procedures describe specific steps to take for different scenarios
Procedures assign responsibility for corrective actions
Procedures address immediate containment and product hold
Procedures address investigation and root cause analysis
Procedures address verification that corrective actions were effective
Procedures define criteria for resuming operations
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of EM corrective action procedures, verification of implementation when positives occur
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate implementation of corrective action procedures when unacceptable EM results received

requirements.text: Are there records of environmental microbiological test results and does testing meet the program requirements?
mandatoryStatements: Environmental monitoring test results are documented and maintained
Records include all required test information (location, date, results, organisms)
Testing frequency meets program requirements
Testing locations match program requirements
Testing methods are appropriate and validated
Records demonstrate consistent implementation of EM program
Trends are analyzed and documented
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly review of EM records for completeness and program compliance
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Testing performed per schedule, results reviewed immediately upon receipt

requirements.text: Is there a written program describing the operation's requirements for seed testing, product testing, or other microbiological or chemical testing not identified in 3.14.02?
mandatoryStatements: Written program describes all required testing beyond environmental monitoring
Program addresses seed testing if applicable
Program addresses finished product testing if applicable
Program addresses other microbiological testing as needed
Program addresses chemical testing as needed (heavy metals, pesticides, etc.)
Program specifies testing frequency, methods, and acceptance criteria
Program is risk-based and scientifically justified
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of testing program for completeness and scientific validity
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly verification that all required testing is performed per program

requirements.text: Are there written risk-based corrective action procedures for when unacceptable seed testing, product testing or other microbiological or chemical test results are received, that describe the steps to be taken, and assign responsibility for taking those steps?
mandatoryStatements: Written corrective action procedures exist for unacceptable test results
Procedures are risk-based and appropriate for different test types
Procedures describe specific steps for seed test failures
Procedures describe specific steps for product test failures
Procedures describe steps for other microbiological or chemical failures
Procedures assign responsibility for corrective actions
Procedures address product hold, investigation, and disposition
Procedures define verification of corrective action effectiveness
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of corrective action procedures, verification when failures occur
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate implementation when unacceptable test results received

requirements.text: Are there records of other tests that are performed for any reason and does testing meet program requirements?
mandatoryStatements: Records are maintained for all testing performed
Records include seed testing results if applicable
Records include product testing results if applicable
Records include other microbiological and chemical testing results
Testing frequency meets program requirements
Testing methods are documented and appropriate
Records demonstrate program compliance
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly review of testing records for completeness and program compliance
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Testing performed per schedule, results documented immediately upon receipt

requirements.text: Where used, are there records of tests performed on compressed air or other mechanically introduced gases that are used directly on food and food contact surfaces and does testing meet the program requirements?
mandatoryStatements: If compressed air or gases contact food or food contact surfaces, testing is performed
Testing records are maintained
Testing includes microbiological and/or particle testing as appropriate
Testing frequency is defined in program
Testing methods are appropriate for intended use
Test results meet acceptance criteria
Non-conforming results trigger corrective actions
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of compressed air/gas testing records and program compliance
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Testing performed per schedule, results reviewed and documented

requirements.text: Are there records of corrective actions taken after unsuitable testing results that describe the steps taken, responsibility for taking those steps, and actions taken to ensure that the cause of contamination has been identified and corrected?
mandatoryStatements: If unsuitable test results occurred, corrective action records exist
Records describe immediate actions taken (product hold, containment)
Records identify person responsible for corrective actions
Records document investigation and root cause analysis
Records show actions taken to correct the cause of contamination
Records show verification that corrective actions were effective
Records demonstrate that contamination source was identified and eliminated
requirements.verificationExpectations: Review of corrective action records for completeness and effectiveness
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Complete documentation of all corrective actions for test failures

requirements.text: Is there a documented training program with training records for the sampling personnel, including aseptic sampling collection techniques, sampling protocols and sample handling?
mandatoryStatements: Documented training program exists for sampling personnel
Training covers aseptic sampling collection techniques
Training covers specific sampling protocols for each test type
Training covers proper sample handling and chain of custody
Training covers sample identification and labeling
Training records document who was trained, when, and on what topics
Only trained personnel collect samples
Retraining provided when procedures change
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of sampling personnel training program and records
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Verification that only trained personnel collect samples, observation of sampling technique

requirements.text: Where food safety related testing is being done in-house, is there a laboratory quality assurance manual with protocols and validated testing methods, evidence of training on testing protocols and methods, and relevant supporting documentation?
mandatoryStatements: If in-house testing performed, laboratory quality assurance manual exists
Manual includes protocols for all tests performed
Testing methods are validated for accuracy and reliability
Evidence of personnel training on testing methods is maintained
Supporting documentation includes method validations, equipment calibrations
Quality control procedures are documented and followed
Laboratory maintains appropriate records and documentation
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of laboratory QA manual and supporting documentation
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly verification that laboratory follows QA procedures and maintains records

requirements.text: Where there is an on-site laboratory, is it completely enclosed and separated from production and storage areas?
mandatoryStatements: If on-site laboratory exists, it is completely enclosed
Laboratory is physically separated from production areas
Laboratory is separated from product storage areas
Separation prevents cross-contamination between lab and production
Laboratory has separate air handling where appropriate
Laboratory access is controlled
Laboratory design prevents contamination risks
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification of laboratory separation and contamination prevention measures
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Ongoing monitoring that laboratory separation is maintained, traffic control enforced

capaInject: If environmental monitoring program not established: develop program within 30 days, begin baseline testing immediately
If EM corrective action procedures not documented: develop procedures within 14 days, implement immediate hold protocol for any positive results
If EM testing not performed per program: immediate catch-up testing, establish monitoring system to ensure future compliance
If unacceptable EM results: immediate product hold, area sanitization, investigation within 24 hours, verify effectiveness before restart
If testing program incomplete: develop comprehensive program within 30 days, initiate missing testing immediately
If corrective actions not documented: immediate documentation of past actions, implement documentation system
If sampling personnel not trained: immediate training before further sample collection, interim use of qualified personnel
If laboratory QA inadequate: develop QA program within 30 days, consider use of external laboratory until QA established
If laboratory not properly separated: immediate risk assessment, implement separation measures or discontinue in-house testing
traceabilityInject: Environmental monitoring results must be traceable to specific locations, dates, and sampling personnel
Test results must be traceable to specific lots, batches, or growing areas
Corrective actions must be traceable to specific test results and affected products
Sampling personnel training must be traceable to individuals and competencies
Laboratory testing must be traceable through chain of custody and sample identification
